meanings.definition: A rounded handle or projection on a door, drawer, or other object.
meanings.sent1: I turned the knob to open the door.
meanings.sent2: The knob on the drawer was shiny and silver.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf tied a tiny bell to the doorknob to play a prank.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like music, turning the knob of my heart.
meanings.sent5: The golden knob gleamed in the sunlight, inviting me to enter.

meanings.sent1: The tree had a knob where a branch had been cut off.
meanings.sent2: She felt a small knob on the surface of the rock.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended the knob on the wall was a secret button.
meanings.sent4: The knob of the hill stood out against the flat landscape.
meanings.sent5: The knob on the toy car made it easy for the child to push.

meanings.definition: A rounded ornament or handle on a piece of furniture or equipment.
meanings.sent1: The antique dresser had intricate knobs on each drawer.
meanings.sent2: He tightened the knob on the machine to secure the part.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully twirled the knob on the stove, pretending to be a DJ.
meanings.sent4: The knob on the guitar added a touch of elegance to the instrument.
meanings.sent5: She carefully selected a crystal knob to match the cabinet's design.
